article_title: Sale of U.K. West Coast Rail Franchise Delayed, Observer Says
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"LL8CNG0YHQ0X01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2011-05-15/sale-of-u-k-west-coast-rail-franchise-delayed-observer-says"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-rJUwfbP"}   A planned auction of the rail franchise that Virgin Trains operates between London and Glasgow, Scotland, has been delayed by Transport Secretary Philip Hammond, the Observer reported, without citing anyone.    The U.K. Department for Transport plans to revise the country’s rail contracts and told bidders that a new agreement for the so-called West Coast line would not start until January 2013, instead of April 2012 as originally planned, the newspaper reported. The bidders shortlisted for the contract are FirstGroup Plc, Dutch-owned operator Abellio, SNCF of France and Virgin Trains, a joint venture between Richard Branson’s Virgin Group and Stagecoach Group Plc, according to the Observer. Virgin Trains has operated the line since 1997.     Published on ‎15‎ ‎May‎, ‎2011‎ ‎12‎:‎23        Have a confidential tip for our reporters?
